contributors.headline: Ukrainian | International HR Student at Saxion
Campus Recruiter - Internships at ASML | International Human Resource Management Student

profile_positions.description:
During the internship, I had an honor to reorganize the whole Intranet page of the department, making the design brighter, the content clearer, and ensuring an easy navigation through all the features of the page. Not only was I responsible for the design, I also took care of all the processes of editing the pages, creating new templates on SharePoint, updating the old material and inserting the new material, and writing a news section for my department.

Moreover, I help the team with any day-to-day tasks they may have, I work closely with a Training manager to help record trainings and upload them into the system, and I am a direct intern of the Head of the Regional department, which brings me insights into all the processes and pillars there are in the department.

In this internship, both my soft and hard skills are being highly developed, I am presented with opportunities to speak in front of groups of managers and also work on technical tasks that develop my skills in different areas. 

So far it has been an amazing journey that has brought me new levels of responsibility, new perspectives on the corporate world, and new great acqaintances.
profile_positions.title: Business Excellence Intern

profile_positions.description:
My first internship landed to be in a huge global company, in its regional center in Amsterdam. I have been a part of a Talent Acquisition team, who took care of the Recruitment processes of the 8 European countries: The Netherlands, Belgium, Portugal, Greece, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland. 

I can proudly say that by the second month of an internship, my team was trusting enough to give me 3 full-time vacancies to fill in Greece, where I had to take care of the whole Recruitment process, starting with posting the job requisition and ending with inviting candidates to interview rounds with the managers. Besides the Recruitment responsibilities, I focused on Employer Branding initiatives, where I brainstormed and later presented the ideas to my supervisor regarding various Employer Branding initiatives for Boehringer Ingelheim. 

I can surely say that I took a lot out of this internship, mainly discipline, attention to details, and seriousness of meeting the deadlines. By the end of this internship, I had worked on a total of 19 positions, some of which were internship positions, student assistant positions, or fill-time ones.
profile_positions.title: HR Intern (Recruitment & Employer Branding)

profile_positions.description: I have been conducting one-on-one classes with the people who decided to study with me after working in Skyeng for 2 years. For these classes, I have been preparing the material to go over with the students by myself and was focusing my attention on developing their Speaking, Reading, Listening, and Writing skills.
profile_positions.title: English Teacher

profile_positions.description:
During the 2 years of me working for Skyeng, I have taught different people of various ages, levels of English ranging from Elementary to Upper-Intermediate. Almost all of the students I took in 2019 stayed with me till my last day at the company.  

The reviews I got from the students when I was leaving the company were really positive, with people highlighting that they found working me easy and reliable. Moreover, they complemented on my people skills, as well as the ability to guide with the material in the way that fosters learning in its best way. After leaving the company, 3 of the students decided to stay with me and keep having classes on my self-employed basis.
profile_positions.title: English Teacher
